object.name: OpClass.{i}.
object.description: The Operating Classes for which this channel scan is requested.

parameter.name: OperatingClass
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} of the OpClass and Channel tuple scanned by the Radio. Note that the Operating Class identifies the band and channel width. For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.

object.name: OpClass.{i}.Channel.{i}.
object.description: The Channels for which this channel scan is requested.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The Channel number of the Channel that is requested to be scanned.

parameter.name: DwellTime
parameter.description: The duration of the time to scan each channel in {{units}}. A value of 50 {{units}} is suggested.

parameter.name: DFSDwellTime
parameter.description: The duration of time to scan each Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) channel in {{units}}. A value of at least one beacon interval, typically 100 {{units}}, is suggested.

parameter.name: HomeTime
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} after which the driver has to go back to the original channel before scanning the next channel to avoid disruption. If this is omitted, or is not supported by the device, then it should be ignored.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The Service Set Identifier (SSID) to scan. If omitted, then all SSIDs are scanned.

parameter.name: TargetBSS
parameter.description: Basic Service Set Identifier (BSSID) of the target BSS which the associated device(s) is to be associated to.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The number of the Wi-Fi channel the backhaul BSS is to be associated to. If {{param}} is not specified, then the radio is to determine which channel to use to associate to the requested {{param|TargetBSS}}.

parameter.name: TimeOut
parameter.description: The maximum timeout for this backhaul steering to occur in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DisassociationImminent
parameter.description: Indicates if the disassociation is imminent, as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.6.13.9}}.

parameter.name: DisassociationTimer
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} until the AP sends a disassociation frame to this station. If {{param}}=0 then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: BSSTerminationDuration
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} for which the BSS is not present. If {{param}}=0 or if this input in not provided, then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: ValidityInterval
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the {{command}} is valid for. If {{param}}=0 or if this input in not provided, then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: SteeringTimer
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that this associated device is not allowed to return to the original BSS. If {{param}}=0 or if this input in not provided, then {{param}} is not used.

parameter.name: TargetBSS
parameter.description: BSSID of the target BSS which the associated device(s) is to be associated to.

parameter.name: DisassociationTimer
parameter.description: The time for which the associated device is to be disassociated in {{units}}. If set to 0, then the associated device is blocked indefinately.

parameter.name: ReasonCode
parameter.description: The reason code for the request for the associated device to be disassociated, as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-49}}.

parameter.name: Silent
parameter.description:
An optional input, if true then this is a request for a Silent Disassociate, whereby the AP is to remove the station from its list of associated devices without sending a message to the station.
If this input in not provided, then a value of {{false}} is assumed.

command.name: SetTrafficSeparation()
command.description:
This command allows or disallows EasyMesh traffic separation {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 19.1}}. If {{param|Enable}} is {{true}} then the parameters defining traffic separation details can also be input with this command.
This command applies to all EasyMesh Agent devices in the Wi-Fi network.
This command can configure {{object|#.Device.{i}.SSIDtoVIDMapping.{i}.}} and {{param|#.Device.{i}.TrafficSeparationAllowed}}.
Status is to be returned after implementation or failed implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
: {{true}}: EasyMesh traffic separation is allowed.
: {{false}}: EasyMesh traffic separation is not allowed.

object.name: SSIDtoVIDMapping.{i}.
object.description:
The Service Set Identifier (SSID) to VLAN ID (VID) mapping for EasyMesh traffic separation {{bibref|EasyMesh}}. Consists of a table of pairs of {{param|SSID}} and corresponding {{param|VID}}.
If this input is not provided, then existing {{object|##.Device.{i}.SSIDtoVIDMapping.{i}.}} apply.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The SSID name.

parameter.name: VID
parameter.description: The VLAN ID (VID).

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to allow or disallow EasyMesh traffic separation. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates successful implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network.

command.name: SetServicePrioritization()
command.description:
This command allows or disallows EasyMesh service prioritization {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 20}}. If {{param|Enable}} is {{true}} then the parameters defining service prioritization details can also be input with this command.
This command can configure {{object|#.Device.{i}.SPRule.{i}.}}, {{param|#.Device.{i}.DSCPMap}} and {{param|#.Device.{i}.ServicePrioritizationAllowed}}.
This command applies to all EasyMesh Agent devices in the Wi-Fi network.
Status is to be returned after implementation or failed implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
: {{true}}: EasyMesh service prioritization is allowed.
: {{false}}: EasyMesh service prioritization is not allowed.

object.name: SPRule.{i}.
object.description:
This object describes a list of service prioritization (SP) rules {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.
If this input is not provided, then existing {{object|##.Device.{i}.SPRule.{i}.}} apply.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: Service prioritization rule Identifier.

parameter.name: Precedence
parameter.description: Rule Precedence – higher number means higher priority.

parameter.name: Output
parameter.description: Rule Output. The value of, or method used to select the 802.1Q C-TAG Priority Code Point (PCP) output value.

parameter.name: AlwaysMatch
parameter.description: Indicates if the rule always matches.

parameter.name: DSCPMap
parameter.description:
A hexadecimal string of 64 PCP values (one octet per value) corresponding to the DSCP markings 0x00 to 0x3F, ordered by increasing DSCP value. Each octet is in the range 0x00 – 0x07. This is used to select a PCP value if a Service Prioritization Rule specifies Rule Output: 0x08.
If this input is not provided, then the existing {{param|#.Device.{i}.DSCPMap}} applies.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to allow or disallow EasyMesh service prioritization. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates successful implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network

command.name: ChannelScanRequest()
command.description:
Request to initiate a channel scan. The operating classes, and list of channels for each operating class, are input. For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz operating classes are valid inputs.
This command should result in updating {{object|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanResult.}}

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: The channel numbers in this Operating Class for which the request to initiate a channel scan applies.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to initiate a channel scan. {{enum}}

command.name: RadioEnable()
command.description:
Request to enable or disable this radio.
This command can result in updating {{param|Enabled}}.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.}}, then this command has the same effect as writing to {{param|Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.Enable}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
: {{true}}: this radio is to be enabled.
: {{false}}: this radio is to be disabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to enable or disable this radio. {{enum}}

command.name: WiFiRestart()
command.description: Request a restart of the Wi-Fi subsystem.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to restart the Wi-Fi subsystem. {{enum}}

command.name: SetSTASteeringState()
command.description:
Disallow or allow EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}} controller-initiated station (STA) steering on this device.
This command can configure {{param|STASteeringState}}.

parameter.name: Disallowed
parameter.description:
: {{true}}: EasyMesh controller-initiated station steering disallowed;
: {{false}}: EasyMesh controller-initiated station steering allowed.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to allow or disallow EasyMesh controller-initiated station steering. {{enum}}

command.name: SetTxPowerLimit()
command.description:
This command sets the upper limit on transmit power {{param|TransmitPowerLimit}} for this radio and {{param|OperatingClass}}.
This command can configure {{param|#.CurrentOperatingClassProfile.{i}.TransmitPowerLimit}}.

parameter.name: TransmitPowerLimit
parameter.description: This is the upper limit on nominal transmit Equivalent Isotropically Radiated Power (EIRP) that this radio can use for the {{param|OperatingClass}}. In units of decibels relative to 1 mW {{units}}.

parameter.name: OperatingClass
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} of the radio. Note that the Operating Class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to set a transmit power limit. {{enum}}

command.name: SetPreferredBackhauls()
command.description: This command sets preferred backhaul links for EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}} backhaul.

object.name: PreferredBackhauls.{i}.
object.description:
Indicates preferred backhaul links for EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}} backhaul. Consists of a table of pairs of MAC addresses. For a WI-Fi connection pair, an entry contains the BSSID and bSTA MAC address. For a wired connection pair, an entry contains the interface MAC addresses. This command applies to all EasyMesh Agent devices in the Wi-Fi network.
Status is to be returned after implementation or failed implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network.

parameter.name: BackhaulMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the BSS, or similar Ethernet interface, on this preferred backhaul link.

parameter.name: bSTAMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the backhaul STA (bSTA), or similar Ethernet interface, on this preferred backhaul link.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to set preferred backhaul links. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates successful implementation of all preferred backhaul links in this Multi-AP network.

command.name: SetSSID()
command.description:
This command specifies an {{param|SSID}} for fronthaul use across this Wi-Fi Multi-AP network, or on this single-AP. Also specifies the {{param|PassPhrase}}, whether to add or remove this SSID, and specifies the {{param|Band}} for each {{param|SSID}}.
This command applies to all EasyMesh Agent devices in the Wi-Fi network, or to this AP in the single-AP case.
This command can be used to set only {{param|PassPhrase}} if {{param|SSID}} matches an existing {{param|#.SSID.{i}.SSID}} for this {{param|Band}} for fronthaul use across this Wi-Fi Multi-AP network.
This command can configure {{object|#.SSID.{i}}}
Status is to be returned after implementation or failed implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The SSID for fronthaul use across this Wi-Fi Multi-AP network.

parameter.name: AddRemove
parameter.description:
Indicates whether to add or remove this {{param|SSID}}.
: {{true}}: add this SSID,
: {{false}}: remove this SSID.
Status is to be returned after implementation or failed implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network.
If set to {{true}}, and this {{param|SSID}} already exists for this {{param|Band}}, then there is no change to the {{param|SSID}}, but the {{param|PassPhrase}} is set.

parameter.name: PassPhrase
parameter.description: The WPA2 Passphrase and/or SAE password for this {{param|SSID}}.

parameter.name: Band
Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to set the SSID. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates successful implementation on all agents/devices/APs in this Multi-AP network

command.name: SetDFSState()
command.description:
Enables/disables the use of Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) channels on this device.
This command can configure {{param|#.DFSEnable}}.

parameter.name: DFSEnable
Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to allow or disallow the use of Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) channels. {{enum}}

command.name: SetAnticipatedChannelPreference()
command.description: This command requests to set the Anticipated Channel Preference. The operating classes, and list of channels for each operating class, are input.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: The channel numbers in this Operating Class.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to set the anticipated channel preference. {{enum}}

command.name: SetMSCSDisallowed()

parameter.name: MSCSDisallowedStaList
parameter.description: List of STAs for which MSCS operation is disallowed.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to disallow MSCS service prioritization to particular STA(s) {{enum}}

command.name: SetSCSDisallowed()

parameter.name: SCSDisallowedStaList
parameter.description: List of STAs for which SCS operation is disallowed.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to disallow SCS service prioritization to particular STA(s). {{enum}}

command.name: SetQMDescriptors()
command.description:
This command configures each of the descriptor elements for Mirrored Stream Classification Service (MSCS), Stream Classification Service (SCS), or QoS Management. {{bibref|EasyMesh}}.
This command can configure {{object|QMDescriptor.{i}.}}.
If {{param|Input.QMDescriptor.{i}.DescriptorElement}} is for SCS or MSCS, the AP adds/changes/removes the rule according to the descriptor element request type.
If a {{param|Input.QMDescriptor.{i}.DescriptorElement}} is a QoS Management DSCP Policy, the AP sends it to the STA identified by the {{param|Input.QMDescriptor.{i}.ClientMAC}}.

object.name: QMDescriptor.{i}.
object.description: This object contains a table of {{param|DescriptorElement}}.

parameter.name: ClientMAC
parameter.description: MAC address of the Station (STA) for which this descriptor applies.

parameter.name: DescriptorElement
parameter.description:
The descriptor element. One of:
: MSCS descriptor element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.243}}, or
: SCS descriptor element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.121}}, or
: QoS Management DSCP policy element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.94}} and {{bibref|RFC8325|Section 6.3}}).

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to configure descriptor elements. {{enum}}

command.name: SetSpatialReuse()
command.description:
This command sets the spatial reuse configuration of this radio. Applies only to Wi-Fi 6 and possibly later generations of radios.
Acronyms: Spatial Reuse Group (SRG), Overlapping Basic Service Set (OBSS), Preamble Detection (PD).
This command can configure {{object|#.SpatialReuse.}}.
If some input parameter(s) are not provided, then the corresponding existing parameter in {{object|#.SpatialReuse.}} applies.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to set the spatial reuse configuration of this radio. {{enum}}

command.name: ChannelScan()
command.description:
This parameter represents a request to initiate a channel scan on this radio on the given channel using a specific {{param|DwellTime}}. This command should result in updating {{object|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanResult.}}
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}}}, then this command is similar to, {{command|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ChannelScanRequest()}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to initiate a channel scan. {{enum}}

command.name: FullScan()
command.description:
This parameter represents a request to initiate a full scan on this radio, including all channels supported by this radio, for a specific {{param|DwellTime}} and {{param|HomeTime}}. This command will result in updating {{object|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanResult.}}
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}}}, then this command is similar to, {{command|Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ChannelScanRequest()}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the type of outcome of the request to initiate a full band scan. {{enum}}

command.name: NeighboringWiFiDiagnostic()
command.description: This command defines access to other WiFi SSIDs that this device is able to receive.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description:
Indicates the availability of diagnostics data. {{enum}}
If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the other results parameters for this test are indeterminate.

command.name: Reset()
command.description: This command represents a request to reset or reboot the Wi-Fi sub-system without resetting or rebooting the device.

command.name: SteerWiFiBackhaul()
command.description:
This command requests the Wi-Fi backhaul link to be steered to associate to a different BSS when the device is working as a bridge in a mesh network. The device needs to already have the necessary credentials for the switch to happen.
The {{param|TargetBSS}} should be an instance of a Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.BSSID.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the response to the Wi-Fi backhaul steering request. {{enum}}

command.name: Disassociate()
command.description: This command represents a request to disassociate this associated device.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the response to the request to disassociate an associated device. {{enum}}

command.name: BTMRequest()
command.description: This command requests initiation of a BSS Transition Management (BTM) request to influence this client's roaming behavior to another BSS as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.6.13.9}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the response to the BSS Transition Management (BTM) request. {{enum}}

event.name: Associated!
event.description: The event is generated when an Associated Device (STA) associates to a BSS.

object.name: WiFi6Capabilities.
object.description: Describes the Wi-Fi 6 capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

event.name: Disassociated!
event.description: The event is generated when an Associated Device (STA) disassociates from a BSS.

event.name: FailedConnection!
event.description: The event is generated when an Associated Device (STA) fails to connect to a BSS.

command.name: RemoteMeasurementRequest()
command.description: This command requests initiation of a Remote Measurement request to retrieve measurement data from a BSS on this radio. Upon receipt of this request, this radio is to initiate a measurement of the output {{param|SignalStrength}} and {{param|Noise}} for the indicated input.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the response to the Remote Measurement request. {{enum}}

command.name: InitiateCCAMeasurement()
command.description: This command represents a request to initiate a Clear Channel Assessment (CCA) measurement scan on this radio on the given channel using a specific {{param|DwellTime}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the response to the request to initiate a Clear Channel Assessment (CCA) measurement. {{enum}}

command.name: InitiateWPSPBC()
command.description: Initiates a Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) Push Button Configuration (PBC) process as defined in {{bibref|WPS 2.0}} .

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the response to the request to start Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) Push Button Configuration (PBC). {{enum}}

command.name: Reset()
command.description:
Reset this {{object|#}} instance's WiFi security settings to their factory default values. The affected settings include {{param|ModeEnabled}}, {{param|WEPKey}}, {{param|PreSharedKey}}, {{param|KeyPassphrase}}, {{param|SAEPassphrase}}, and {{param|#.WPS.PIN}} (if applicable).
If the command cannot be executed, the agent MUST reject the command. Possible failure reasons include a lack of default values or if {{param|ModeEnabled}} is an Enterprise type, i.e. {{enum|WPA-Enterprise|ModesSupported}}, {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModesSupported}}, {{enum|WPA3-Enterprise|ModesSupported}}, or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Enterprise|ModesSupported}}.
